p: Arbidol (ARB) was licensed for the treatment of influenza and other respiratory viral infections in Russia and China [ 72, 73]. Blaising and coauthors consider ARB to be a broad spectrum antiviral drug [ 72]. In addition, ARB has been reported to inhibit SARS-CoV in vitro. Therefore, a clinical trial of ARB-treated COVID-19-positive patients has been registered [ 65].
